intro: Cyrtandra ustulata, commonly known as the flamebrush or Hawaiian flamebrush, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Cyrtandra ustulata plays an important ecological role in its native environment, supporting various pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of Hawaiian flora.
